creator: martin123456789@hotmail.com
text:
I have a test plan that needs access to a database and LDAP but uses different 
users for each.

I have a JDBC Database Login Defaults and tried to add a Login Configs (for 
LDAP) as well as an LDAP Request Defaults.

After adding debug statements to the ldap sample I found that the database's 
username and password (defined in the JDBC Database Login Defaults - Login 
Configuration section) in the LDAP connection rather than the username and 
password from the Login Configs (yes, Login Configs was placed after the DB).

creator: martin123456789@hotmail.com
text:
Created attachment 13755
Here's a sample testplan to illustrate

if you try it you will get a DN error (#34) but after removing the DB defaults
and sample; it should work

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: JDBC no longer uses a login config so the problem can't arise
